text: Simple, végétal, luminous and pretty bar/ resto. You can feel a great team of people achieved this Resto-bar concept. The small menu only contains original side food ideas perfect for sharing with whomever.  Their wonderful bay windows make it the perfect place for a first date.That's right! Sitting at the tables next to them gives you the opportunity to do a lot of people watching. People watching is always a good conversation starter. Located corner of St-Laurent and Duluth, lots of cool weirdos pass by and it is just a great location in general. The music totally hit the spot with me; 80's New Wavish music. Perfect volume. Impeccable service and attitude. Thank you Suzanne!!
Friendly services, fun drinks, good vibe, beautiful decor. Your friendly neighborhood bar. I would recommend to anyone.

This place is a pub in disguise. Fancy decor, fancy cocktails. Trying to be bougie, but it's not. Save yourself some money and get a beer if ever you're stuck in here. If you want a proper cocktail, go elsewhere.
Very nice ambiance and space but the drinks are both surprisingly small and expensive. It was a good enough experience but I probably won't ever go back.

Par hasard, nous passons au début de la rue Duluth devant un lieu dont n'avions pas la connaissance et dont sort une musique lounge qui nous attire.. nous montons donc et la serveuse nous propose 2 choix :  - une partie plus club, lounge et chaises hautes. - la cantine, boisée et très verte avec des plantes au plafond et la vue sur la cuisine.  Choix pour la cantine. Je commande le cocktail Suzanne Fizz et la belle commande du vin blanc. Mon breuvage est bon quoiqu'un peu soft. Il n'y a que du Saké comme alcool dedans donc j'accepte ! Le vin de ma blonde par contre, est clairement tiède et pas assez frais.  Nous apprenons par la suite que c'est un nouvel établissement qui vient d'ouvrir début de semaine, qui propose également des dumplings (pour ton info)  La machine n'est pas encore bien lancée et cela se sent, dans le service, dans les petites attentes car les serveurs et serveuses venaient " plic ploc " nous voir, dans ce vin trop tempéré..Mais on a pris le temps de venir nous demander notre avis et de discuter un peu.. Donc pourquoi ne pas revenir laisser une seconde chance à ce lieu qui tente lui aussi le pari de faire revivre la rue Duluth (qu'on adore), et dont l'ambiance dépaysante est réussie, c'est déjà ça !

Depuis le temps que je voulais essayer cet endroit! La décoration est magnifique et donne l'impression que nous sommes sur une terrasse.  Ce n'est pas le plus grand bar, mais il y a suffisamment de places et de l'espace pour ne pas être trop entassé les uns sur les autres. Une bonne ambiance et qui peut être propice pour les dates. La musique n'est pas trop forte, je recommande cette place pour les personnes qui souhaitent se retrouver entre amis pour une soirée tranquille. Ma seule déception est qu'il n'y a pas assez de choix dans les cocktails.

Went here last night with a group of friends and loved it. The food is fantastic - we ordered the beef curry and shrimp pork dumplings (with squid ink dough!), which were both delicious. The green beans were insanely good and those fries are the best I've had in a long time. Drinks weren't exceptional, but they were still tasty cocktails. I'll be back every time I come through Montreal.
superbe deco, très bien situé. staff sympathique. bouffe correcte.

Bar tres cozy, tendance, avec plein de plantes et de verdure Le mieux est de reserver une table si vous ne voulez pas faire le line up Nous avons pu reserver pour un groupe pour un 5@7, ce qui est tres cool. Les cocktails avaient tous l'air bon, celui aux bleuets etait tres bon. Mes amis ont pris des bieres plutôt. Les dumplings sont tres bons, mais celui au homard et boeuf ne goute pas du tout le homard. Les frites maison etaient bonnes aussi. Excellent service, à la fin il y avait beaucoup de monde (vendredi soir) donc cetait moins rapide.  Musique forte à partir de 19h aussi... A essayer!

We were strolling at Duluth and came across this bar. Decided to go inside as it looked very happening and full from the outside.  We waited for 20 mins and ended up getting seats at the bar. The service is efficient and friendly!!   My favourite part of the bar is that the space just opens up. There are lots of plants around and the lighting is perfect. It gives the bar the right kind of cosy feel making it the perfect spot for a romantic night out or even a night out with friends.   Definitely glad we chose to come here. Will definitely we coming by again very soon!

Great food, a lot of care went into making  it all feel like a hole. Great dumplings on the menu with inspired drink to go along with it. The space is well designed, keeps it simple.  Defenetly a place to have a good time that will keep you there for longer than you expected.

So happy I came here!  First of all, beautiful atmosphere. Perfect for a date night, or just getting together a group of friends for a fun night of drinking. Lots of beautiful plants and lighting to cheer you up over this dreary winter. They always have awesome  djs and the scene is really chill. Great wine selection and I  love the balsamic fries and dumplings. The staff is friendly and attentive too which is always a plus! Not superficial like other places. Overall amazing atmosphere! Will definitely keep coming back

Super belle décoration, initiant une atmosphère agréable.  Le seul bémole c'est qu'il y avait peu de gens, même pour un samedi soir, donc l'ambiance ne nous invitait pas pour rester prendre plus verres. Le staff était sympathique et attentif à nos besoins. Belle expérience!

This bar is wonderful! The service was friendly and approachable and the space is beautiful. Way bigger than it seems. This would be a great place if you're looking for a quick bite in a well-lit but cozy space.   THE SPACE + SERVICE: Covered in plants -- so pretty! This place has a greenhouse feel. One side has the bar and some communal high tables. The other side of the bar has bigger sit down tables for bigger groups and the opening to the kitchen. It was nice these two spaces were distinct, as we sat on the quieter bar side while a big group was on the bigger side.   THE MENU: Tasty and fun. We enjoyed every cocktail we got (). Some of them were a little sweet, though. We were too full for food, but the interesting dumpling variations caught our eye. Would come back here in a second for the space and the interesting menu.

Endroit vraiment sympathique pour boire un verre. La déco est vraiment jolie et les serveurs accueillant.   Le cocktail que j'ai pris le martini rosé était excellent mais cher pour la quantité dommage.   Je recommande quand même
Best bar in Montreal. If you're looking to start your day off with some tasty drinks and tropical vibes this place is a must!

I liked it! The bar is beautiful and in such a great spot, I loved the big open ceiling and huge windows and plants everywhere. I loved the quote on the way up the stairs that got the Leonard Cohen song Suzanne in my head on my way in. All of the staff were kind and helpful and present, and I loved the vegan Whisky Sour and the glass of sparkling wine I had.   The food, I gotta by real, was only ok. We started with oysters which were fresh, and not outrageously priced which I appreciate, but they weren't cut out of their shells which made them pretty hard to eat. We got six with a regular mignonette, and 6 with a house special with a kind of watermelon foam that for me just didn't work. Too sweet, just weird with oysters. We also ordered some dumplings, I had the one veggie option on the menu, basically pureed eggplant which I loved the taste of but the dumpling skins were too thick and heavy.   I will definitely go back because I really liked the vibe. There's other little bites on the menu I'd try but mostly I'd go for drinks with friends.

Bar Suzanne, je voulais tellement t'aimer. Si y'a deux choses que j'aime beaucoup dans la vie, c'est bien les dumplings et prendre un verre. L'idée est si bonne! En plus le décor est tellement mignon.   Mais parlons un peu de ta nourriture, Bar Suzanne... La viande n'était pas cuite dans mes dumplings, il n'y avait pas de chair sur les feuilles d'artichauts de mes amies et le carpaccio de canard était vraiment moyen.   Bar Suzanne, je voulais tellement t'aimer que j'aurais préféré simplement donner un thumbs up à mon serveur lorsqu'il est passé pour nous demander si tout était bon. Malheureusement, le commentaire méritait d'être dit.   Honorable mention cependant à notre serveur qui était hyper gentil malgré le feedback plutôt négatif (on pourrait aussi appeler ça une critique constructive - ça fait moins méchant). Après avoir consulté le chef, qui était assez déçu, on nous a offert des dumplings cuit. C'était mieux. Mais pas wow.   À bientôt peut-être, mais juste pour un verre de vin.

La décoration est sublime. Le niveau sonore est un peu fort du côté "bar" mais parfait du côté des tables (vers la cuisine).  Une dizaine de cocktails sur la carte qui sont originaux et qui ont tous l'air délicieux ! Le menu de tapas et dumplings  est alléchant et environ 1/3 sont végétariens. Les dumplings n'ont rien à voir avec des dumplings chinois mais ils sont tout de même délicieux ! Dommage qu'ils n'aient pas de desserts !  Le staff est très sympathique.  Un bel endroit que je recommande à tous !
Amazing atmosphere. The roof is too cool with Ivys growing down from the ceiling boxes. Unique cocktails and the menu is creative. Definitely will be back!
We didn't have food but the cocktails were top notch, with a decent amount of alcohol (rare!). Stylish yellow-ish space with non-intrusive music.

The little table near the open balcony window was too sunny and welcoming for me to not poke my head in and check this place out. They've redone the space to be airy, welcoming and full of plants- I came on a sunny afternoon and it was a beautiful spot for a quick drink. Great service -  the cocktail and dumplings I tried were yum. I definitely want to come back check it out at night!

This place blew me away - completely unexpectedly. The music upon entering was on point - so perfect for the venue. The service was friendly and very helpful we loved our waiters!!! The food was delicious - mind blown by the lobster beef dumplings and the fried chicken - oh, and make sure to order the fries they are a standout. Also the most comfortable chairs ever. We will be back for sure!!!!!!!

Don't know if I'd call this a speakeasy.  It's in a charming location in Montreal.  The bar has a bunch of Leonard Cohen references, starting with the name!  There's a fun cocktail card, the staff is nice and attentive and the place is very nice.  Would go back!

Nice cute little place, original somewhat concept. I especially like their ceiling, if you there be sure to check it out. Their drinks are original and delish, I haven't eaten there yet, but the dining area does look pretty cool.   Service? Very good, friendly and quick, just like I like it. Atmosphere? Nice and romantic and cool at the same time, whether it's a night out with friends or a date. Overall? Yep, I'll be back for more.

Cool bar on the block. I have a friend who lives just around the corner so we hopped for a drink. The place has a super cool vibe, the hanging plants the music it all works great. The staff were super friendly and easy on the free shots as well :) Beer selection is ok not amazing, but this is more of a romantic, date kinda of a pub. They have a cool twist on the fries with fish sauce and Japanese mayo. Overall I felt happy discovering a cool new spot they I am pretty sure I will re-visit

I have to agree with a lot of the other reviewers on this place- bar Suzanne really shines because of the space. I appreciate, above the beautiful decor and the fantastic music, that it's a sizeable bar that gives a lot of room to each patron. There's zero sense of being on top of one another here, which is fantastic. In that vein, it makes a really nice date spot (I think 75% of the people we saw last night were on some sort of date). Additionally, the service was really attentive and things are pretty reasonably priced for what you get.  Where they drop the ball, as others have commented, is on the food. I'll have to give other plates a try in the future, but the dumplings were a lunch bag let down. We ordered the two veggie dumplings and both tasted like over-seasoned baby food in a dumpling wrapper. I'm not sure why they insist on puréeing the contents of the dumplings beyond recognition but it doesn't do justice to their ingredients.  The drinks were ok- I ordered a gin cocktail with grapefruit/rosemary syrup. I'm a citrus fiend but the syrup really overpowered the rest of the flavours and I wasn't able to distinguish the roméo gin (a gin tasty enough on its own) from everything else. The beers, however, were reasonably priced and I appreciate that they have a decent variety.
